item.description:
Boston Night Tour http://www.hauntedbostontours.com/tourinformation.htm offers a 90 minute walking tour of Boston's notoriously haunted sites and tells the stories associated with these "haunts".  Let's attend as a group and see if we can achieve getting anyone scared.

If we get more than 10 people we can pre-reserve spots, otherwise it's walk up reservations that day. 

Great news for cost - there's a coupon this week for $5 tickets (normally $11).  Just follow this link: 

http://2dafd79a-8ea4-11e0-8677-0024e8696030.kgbdeals.com?id=29843

The plan:

6:30 pm - grab a bite:  Let's meet in the rotunda of Quincy Market and get a table.  Everyone can grab their favorite food from one of the 50+ food vendors there.  I'll have a Meetup sign on our table. 

7:45 pm - meet at the ticket booth "ArtsBoston Booth"  ( The new ArtsBoston booth is on Boston's historic Freedom Trail, adjacent to Faneuil Hall, and just a short walk from the Government Center, Haymarket and State Street T stops. The booth, a freestanding kiosk, is near the West End entrance of Quincy Market. The closest parking is at 75 State Street or the Government Center Garage near Haymarket.)

8:00 pm - tour begins

9:30 pm - tour ends...  drinks?
item.how_to_find_us: Stacy will provide cell phone info and to all who RSVP and will hold a Meetup sign for those meeting at the booth
item.name: Boston Night Tour (Ghost tour)
